Quasi-Synchronous Grammars

Jan 15, 2018

  • Quasi-Synchronous Grammars: PDF
  • Authors: David A. Smith and Jason Eisner
  • Venue: Workshop on Statistical Machine Translation, 2006

Introduction

This paper from David A. Smith and Jason Eisner introduces a new formalism, a ‘‘Quasi-Synchronous Grammar” (QG), motivated by problems in machine translation. I found it via Woodsend and Lapata (2010), which applies the formalism to sentence simplification. I’ve also seen such grammars applied to question answering. Given that QGs seem to be a (somewhat obscure) part of the NLP research world and because I am sort of sick reading modifications of Bandanau et al. 2014 I decided to really dig into Smith and Eisner’s approach.

At a high level, the paper does the following:

  1. Introduce the QG formalism
  2. Describe how to parameterize a probabilistic QG
  3. Evaluate a QG on a machine translation task.

The formalism

QGs are an extension of an earlier formalism: the synchronous grammar.
